previous_statement: Step 1.3.4 (Volume Conjecture connection): The exponential growth rate Vol_hyp(q) of the quantum 6j symbol is the central object of the Volume Conjecture (Kashaev 1997, Murakami-Murakami 2001): for the figure-eight knot complement, 2pi log |J_n(q)|/n -> Vol(S^3 \ K) as n -> infinity with q = exp(2pi i/n). The q-BLM model provides a physical quantum mechanical system where this exponential growth has direct dynamical consequences — it controls the relative weight of non-melonic Feynman diagrams and the breakdown of the 1/j perturbative expansion.
new_statement: Step 1.3.4 (Volume Conjecture — motivating analogy, not mathematical equivalence): (A) THE VOLUME CONJECTURE (CORRECTLY STATED). The Volume Conjecture (Kashaev 1997, Murakami-Murakami 2001) concerns the COLORED JONES POLYNOMIAL J_N(K;q), a knot invariant — NOT the quantum 6j symbol directly. For any hyperbolic knot K in S^3, the conjecture states: lim_{N -> inf} (2*pi/N) * log |J_N(K; e^{2*pi*i/N})| = Vol(S^3 \ K), where Vol denotes the simplicial volume (equal to the hyperbolic volume for hyperbolic knots, zero for non-hyperbolic knots). The evaluation point q = e^{2*pi*i/N} is DETERMINED by N and varies with it; q is NOT a free parameter. As N -> infinity, q -> 1 along roots of unity on the unit circle. This is a SEMICLASSICAL limit (hbar ~ 2*pi/N -> 0). The connection to 6j symbols is INDIRECT: J_N can be expressed via state sums over triangulations involving products of quantum 6j symbols (e.g., via the shadow state sum formula or ideal triangulations), but the VC concerns the collective behavior of the full state sum — not the asymptotics of any individual 6j symbol. The exponential growth rate of a single 6j symbol gives the volume of one TETRAHEDRON in a triangulation; the VC volume is that of the ENTIRE knot complement, emerging from the interaction of all tetrahedra. (B) REGIME DISTINCTION: VC vs BLM. The VC regime and the BLM regime are incommensurable: (i) VC: q = e^{2*pi*i/N} is COMPLEX (|q|=1), a root of unity that VARIES with the representation label N. Both q and N change together. This is a semiclassical limit. (ii) BLM (parent node 1.3): q is REAL and POSITIVE, FIXED, while the spin j -> infinity independently. q does not change. (iii) The mathematical objects differ: the VC involves finite-dimensional representations of U_q(su(2)) at root of unity, while fixed real q > 0 involves a different algebraic regime. These are different domains (complex unit circle vs positive real line), different limiting procedures (q varying vs q fixed), and in general different mathematical structures. There is NO theorem establishing a mathematical equivalence between the VC and the large-j BLM model at fixed real q. (C) THE ACTUAL CONNECTION: SHARED ALGEBRAIC BUILDING BLOCKS. What the VC and the q-BLM model genuinely share is the quantum 6j symbol as an algebraic building block: (i) In the VC (via state sum formulations): the colored Jones polynomial can be expressed as sums of products of quantum 6j symbols over triangulations of the knot complement. The exponential growth of these 6j symbols at roots of unity, governed by hyperbolic tetrahedron volumes (proven: Belletti-Yang 2025, see node 1.3.1 part A), is the microscopic mechanism underlying the VC. (ii) In the q-BLM model: non-melonic Feynman diagrams involve quantum 6j symbols (and higher recoupling symbols) as coupling constants. If these symbols grow exponentially at fixed real q (CONJECTURAL, see node 1.3.1 part B), this would affect the relative weight of non-melonic diagrams. The shared building block is the quantum 6j symbol. But sharing a building block does not establish a mathematical connection between the models, just as the appearance of Gaussian integrals in both quantum field theory and statistics does not connect particle physics to polling. (D) MOTIVATING ANALOGY (properly qualified). The connection between the VC and the q-BLM model is a MOTIVATING ANALOGY, not a mathematical theorem: Both settings involve quantum recoupling symbols whose asymptotics (proven at roots of unity, conjectured at fixed real q) are controlled by hyperbolic geometry. This suggests — but does not prove — that the q-BLM model at q \!= 1 may encode aspects of hyperbolic 3D geometry, analogous to how the q=1 model encodes Euclidean 3D geometry via the Ponzano-Regge formula. To upgrade this analogy to a theorem would require at least one of: (1) showing that some BLM observable computes a knot invariant (not established), (2) embedding the BLM model into a Boulatov-type GFT whose Feynman amplitudes are TV/state-sum invariants (open problem, see node 1.4.2), or (3) a rigorous asymptotic analysis of the full BLM partition function (not the individual diagrams) showing emergence of hyperbolic volumes. None of these has been accomplished. (E) CONDITIONAL IMPLICATIONS FOR BLM DYNAMICS. The dynamical claims from the original statement are CONJECTURAL and depend on unproven results: IF quantum 6j symbols at fixed real q grow exponentially (conjecture, node 1.3.1 part B), THEN the coupling constants in non-melonic BLM Feynman diagrams grow exponentially in j, which would disrupt the polynomial suppression mechanism underlying melonic dominance at q=1 (conditional analysis, node 1.3.2). This conditional chain motivates the conjecture that the large-j expansion of the q-BLM model changes qualitatively at q \!= 1. However: (i) no formula for the ratio of non-melonic to melonic diagram contributions at q \!= 1 has been derived, (ii) the existence and structure of a 1/j expansion at q \!= 1 has not been established, and (iii) sub-exponential corrections, sign cancellations, and summation effects could modify or negate the naive individual-diagram analysis. STATUS: This node provides CONTEXT AND MOTIVATION from the Volume Conjecture for the study of the q-BLM model. It does NOT establish a mathematical connection between the two. The VC is correctly a statement about colored Jones polynomials at roots of unity; the BLM model operates at fixed real q. Their relationship is through shared algebraic building blocks (quantum 6j symbols) and a suggestive parallel between the role of hyperbolic geometry in both settings.
